head.title: Wind Power Should Be Part of an Energy Plan

hedline.hl1: Wind Power Should Be Part of an Energy Plan

abstract.p: Pete Spain letter on August 3 article on replacement for Indian Point nuclear power plant holds wind energy should not be dismissed

block.p: Regarding ''In Place of Indian Point'' ( Aug. 3): As for opposition to wind turbines because they ''have been known to cut up flying birds,'' On Sept. 10, 2001, the Audubon Society issued a statement relating to birds and wind energy, saying that the number of bird fatalities resulting from the impact with wind plants could be lessened by the use of new designs and by siting wind energy plants away from endangered species nesting areas.

Today, while wind-generated power alone cannot replace Indian Point, wind power should not be dismissed frivolously. It is a viable piece of an energy plan for the 21st century. Along with other such safe and clean renewable energy options, (biofuels, geothermal, solar, tidal) wind power deserves increased prominence in our energy pool -- not just Westchester's but also America's.

No clean renewable energy options should be dismissed yet. Today, these options combined with advances in energy efficiency are already reducing pollution, greenhouse gas emissions, and our dependence on fossil fuels.
